description: This course integrates economic, ethical and political perspectives. It examines competing theories, models, and analytical frameworks for understanding policymaking. The course will focus on: 1. How public problems are framed and described; 2. What crieteria are useful in developing and assessing policy choices; and 3. How policy choices and outcomes are mediated and influenced by individuals, organizations and political institutions.
name: PUBLIC POLICY PROCESS: The Public Policy Process

section.name: PUBLIC POLICY PROCESS: The Public Policy Process
